intro: Crematomia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), helping it retain moisture in its natural habitat. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often pollinated by bees and other insects.
